name: The Spa Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on the 8th Feb, this was a gift for my 65th birthday from my young cousin, and what a treat. The room was brilliant (208) with a huge bathroom, lots of comfort. Food in the restaurant was excellent at Dinner and breakfast. Everyone of the staff was very attentive and very smiley!
reviews.title: RETURN VISIT

reviews.text: This time there was jazz band in the bar, although it crowded and we couldn't get a seat, we could still hear them from the main reception lounge. Next time I would suggest they hold it in a bigger room.
reviews.title: Dinner dance

reviews.text: We had massages booked which were wonderful. In fact it was so good I went back last Friday so I could destress from my home/work life. It worked. Feel like new again. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Business overnight

reviews.text: Great Hotel (but)
reviews.title: Worst night ever
Well organised throughout
reviews.text: The ambiance was excellent. We would stay again.

My partner and I stayed at The Spa Hotel in October 2008 and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were massive, the king size beds, big and comfy and the bathrooms well equiped, with lovely white fluffy towels. The rooms are a little dated, but are clean and smart looking.
reviews.title: Lovely Big beds and huge bathrooms!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, wonderful food, lovely big rooms, massive beds.
likes.disliked: — Stolen shorts, expensive drinks, old fashioned decour.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We dined at the Hotel restaurant in the evening and had a wonderful a la carte meal; well worth a try- there was a very formal atmosphere, but as we were a large group, that didnt deter us from enjoying the occassion. Our waiter was excellent, Kenny, he went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable, and really made the evening special for us. The food was excellent as was the wine and the cocktail bar, if expensive, but is worth the money if you pay for evening meal in the price of your room.
reviews.title: as good as it gets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool was all that we used in regards to the spa facilities, but the gym was well equiped and the staff were hospitable.
reviews.title: This is just NOT a spa!!!!

reviews.text: Breakfast the followng morning, was again, unfaltered, with lots to choose from, cereal, fry ups, fresh fruit etc and the staff friendly (even the ones who had worked late the night before!).
reviews.title: Spa Hotel?

reviews.text: My only gripes were that we accidently left a pair of swimming shorts in the room and after we left and realised this later the same day, the hotel had no record of them being found, so they were basically stolen from the room after we left, within a few hours!!
reviews.title: well run good old-fashioned quality hotel

likes.liked: — good quality experience and good value for money
likes.disliked: — the rooms could do with an update

reviews.text: We only stayed one night for a family party. It's a nice hotel. The reception area is pleasant, big comfy sofa's for afternoon tea (which looked lovely although we didn't have one). We ordered coffee, I asked for a cafetiere. The coffee was nearly £4 per person and it was awful! Just a pot of overheated filter coffee. For that money I expect a pretty decent cup of coffee. It sounds petty, but just one thing that would make this hotel so much better.
reviews.title: It's pretty good, but could be sooo much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The standard room we had was nice. It was quite large which is a pleasant surprise for a standard room. A big bed, but very hard for my taste. The windows opened which was good because it was very very hot in the hotel. Lovely big bathroom with fluffy towels but no robes.
reviews.title: Lovely Building. Excellent Food. Disappointing Spa.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good, but it should be for the price. Lots of fresh fruit, pastries and toast. The english cooked breakfast was really yummy, but why the relunctance to leave the ketchup on the table? Is it rationed?
reviews.title: A mixed experience...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool is OK, very small though, but it was nice to go for an after dark swim as it looks very pretty all lit up. But overall the spa area is pretty disappointing. It was really cold, and you have to run through the spa reception in your swimmies to get to the pool (and then you really feel the cold). This area could really do with a refit.
reviews.title: On The Up

reviews.text: We took advantage of their two night Winter Getaway break and stayed Friday and Saturday night for £89 per person, per night. Included were bed, breakfast and evening meal.
reviews.title: Its good and getting better

reviews.text: What a beuatiful hotel set in stunning grounds just outside Tunbridge Wells. I cannot fault the hotel along with its high calibre staff. A sumptuous menu was accompanied by an excellent service. The decadent 'Zagatos' champagne bar was the highlight, taste the finest chamganes or cocktails while emersing yourself in the chic decor of this brand new bar. A truly fantastic stay left me feeling refreshed and longing to go back!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at the Spa Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival to The Spa hotel, we were politely greeted by a well presented reception team, and offered if we needed help with our bags, and gave us good discriptions to the locations and opening times of the faciliteies (restaurant, bar, and spa).
reviews.title: Superb & relaxing

likes.liked: — Atmosphere, and the improvements on decor! The Champagne bar!!

reviews.text: There is a bit of refurbishment being carried out at the hotel, but all areas are accessible, and what has been done looks fantastic
reviews.title: Not worth the money

reviews.text: - the champagne bar is very chic and modern, giving off a brilliant vibe, and will surely be buzzing most nights, and afternoons!!
reviews.title: Filthy, overpriced and shabby
Extremely dissapointing
reviews.text: Our room was clean, and a good size, and all the staff looked after us as if we were the only guests there - the hotel was busy creating a pleasant friendly atmosphere - all staff were very helpful and the food was delightful.

Me and my husband booked the one night stay offer we found on the website including dinner, breakfast and use of spa facilities. The hotel looked great from outside and I was pleasantly suprised how nice it was inside, especially our poster bed bedroom. The bathroom was clean and huge with bath and shower separate. In the evening we had dinner and I have to admit it was one of the best meals i've had in a while. The spa is nice and simple, maybe not the hotel's strongest point but we did not have any complains. If you are staying at this hotel for a top of the range spa facilities (pool, jacuzzi,sauna) then it is not this hotel. In the morning we had our massage and it was soo relaxing. The treatment facilities are nice and the girls were really good at what they do. If you are looking for a nice weekend break with a lovely meal and a massage then this is the place to go.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Upon arrival the hotel looked lovely. Check in time was 3pm but we arrived early and our rooms were ready. room 308 - initially main room was ok but large black marks on wall looked like damp! large bathroom with ugly brown lino flooring
reviews.title: hardly 4 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room 316 no black marks but bathroom was similar, no real dressing table mirror just small free standing mirror, tv sited to the side so not easy to view from bed.
reviews.title: THe Best in Tunbridge Wells

reviews.text: Room 101 bathroom flooring was lifted in areas.
reviews.title: Old Style - But with Surprises!

reviews.text: Went downstair to get afternoon tea to find all the tables reserved in lounge for non residents, had lunch in the bar area.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Stayed at the Spa for a wedding and a lovely time was had by all.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.text: As we were only there did 1 night, we didn't use the spa facility's.
reviews.title: Love it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our room was on the first floor and was a nice size room, but the view was of the main roofs! If I designed this room I would frost the windows.
reviews.title: Many thanks to the Spa Hotel

reviews.text: The bed was a little soft for my liking, but this is probably due to its age.
reviews.title: pleasant

reviews.text: The room itself was a little cold and thd AC only cooled the room and not heat.
reviews.title: Nice room shame about the service

reviews.text: Spent the weekend here where we were attending a wedding. Cannot find anything to fault the hotel for the staff were all very friendly and helpful and the food at both the wedding reception and breakfast was fantastic.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in lovely grounds

reviews.text: The room was on the third floor and it was a great night sleep.It was nicely decorated with a large bathroom. I would suggest if attending a wedding here it would be worth spending the money and staying here it is slightly expensive but you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Overall, no big issues and I would certainly stay again

reviews.text: There are also large grounds at the rear of the hotel and with the sun was lovely for a walk round.
reviews.title: Did not live up to my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a lovely building in beautiful grounds. The service was efficient if not overly friendly. Rooms seem a little smaller than average compared to hotels of a similar standard, although this is down to the age of the building. The decor, whilst certainly not shabby, seems a little dated. The room was very clean and well prepared, although it was stiflingly hot and we had to turn off the heating.
reviews.title: Smart, refined, pleasant hotel

reviews.text: We experienced the full range of food, from more formal dining to the bar menu in Zagatos Bar and sandwiches in the lounge at lunchtime. The food is excellent.
reviews.title: Spa Hotel - wheelchair access but with drawbacks

reviews.text: we stayed here for 4 days as part of a garden tour and after a long journey on the bus from the seaport i was so so tired and just wanted too crash on the bed, as part of a tour of 13 when we arrived we were welcomed with a really nasty look from a guy at the reception kinda looked like harry potter and he just took ages too sort our rooms, not a 4 star service ,any ways after all that i was lead up the stairs which seemed to me some thing out of an assault course so when i finally got to my room, it was small and stuffy just not right for me at all, but didn't complain as i didn't think harry potter would wave his magic waned and make it better.so later on we all met up in the lounge and were looked after by Ziby he was funny and made us feel at home, and then we went for dinner at hotels restaurant and we were welcomed by this very nice young man called Kenny and this guy took care of us all he was so nice and down to earth the service was far greater from what i expected and the food well thats had to be the best i have ever had in a long time, Kenny kept us all entertained and nothing was too much trouble for him even on one occasion they ran out of my favorite cereal and when i asked a member of staff about it he just replied 'what you see is all we have' which i thought was a bit disappointing so when i asked if kenny was around he just ignored me and walked away, but then we were having some drinks in the bar and our tour guide was saying how he saw kenny at a supermarket near by shopping around ,and yup sure enough my cereal was back on the menu by the next morning, later on he came and asked us if every thing was fine with our stay so i though i could take advantage of that and ask for fan for my room as its just too hot, as i was asking him a nice kid called gary happens to walk by and kenny asked him if there is a chance i could have a fan in my room and there was one by the time i finished my breakfast. all in all the hotel was average but two staff made it a wonderful stay and it truly made feel like i was staying in a 5 star, also the girls at the spa club were very nice to me and i will come back the next time i come over to england.
reviews.title: loved the spa staff

likes.liked: — gary kenny and ziby, spa staff

reviews.text: regards
reviews.title: Not for young families

likes.liked: — Nice decor and handy for the Channel Tunnel
likes.disliked: — Small bedroom and lack of provision for small children

reviews.text: miss Murphy
reviews.title: Great service, clean hotel.

reviews.text: Austin,TX
reviews.title: Encouring signs for a great hotel

likes.liked: — The newly renovated bar, lounge and bedroom

reviews.title: Wonderful times at The Spa
reviews.text: Stayed here as part of a road trip to Disneyland Paris. We were looking for a nice hotel with a swimming pool close to the Channel Tunnel. On browsing we found The Spa Hotel, and it seemed to fit the bill. Arrived early after a drive down from Coventry. Receptionist didn't seem too impressed that we were early, but let us in to our room. Hotel is in process of being renovated, and it is being completed to a very high standard. If it was just myself and my husband, then this hotel would have been perfect for a romantic getaway. Impressive lounge where being Sunday Afternoon Tea was being served. Our room although being nicely decorated, and having a spacious luxury bathroom was tiny. We really struggled to fit our travel cot in. We ate lunch at the hotel and had to feed my son bits from our plates as there was no provision made for small children. Ordered him a fruit salad - which at 5 pounds was really overpriced. We didn't eat dinner in the restaurant as again there was no kids meals (althougth the menu for adults sounded nice). Used the swimming pool which although not the biggest was nice for a dip, and the underfloor heating at the poolside was super cosy. Not sure about the guy swimming in his underwear - glad he left soon after we went in!!! Nice selection at breakfast, but again not really catering for the kids. The waitress fetched a highchair which by looking at the dirt on it isn't used very often. The straps were broken, so spent breakfast trying to keep a grip on a mountain climbing 1yr old and munching on my toast. Between that and the constant looks from the manager, we didn't have the most relaxing start to the day. For couples then this hotel is perfect for a nice getaway. For families give this one a miss.

description: This 18th century mansion is blessed with glorious gardens, great bedrooms and a leisure club. It's adjacent to Tunbridge Wells Golf Club and a short walk to the town centre. The 21st century renaissance of The Spa began in 2006 with its acquisition by Chris Scragg. With the lounge, restaurant, meeting rooms, ballroom, and ground floor refurbished and the all new Zagatos Champagne bar. The Spa Hotel is first choice for both business and pleasure.
